history.proof: intros H d Hgcd. destruct Hgcd as [HdO [HdO' Hgcd']]. qsimpl time: 1 use: gcd_null. - sfirstorder depth: 3use: gcd_null. - sfirstorder unfold: divide.

exceptions.tactic: apply gcd_null in HdO as HdOeq.
exceptions.exn: Unable to apply lemma of type "forall a b : S, is_gcd a b O -> a = O /\\ b = O" on hypothesis of type "divide d O".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
S: Set
A: S -> Prop
Mult: S -> S -> S
Add: S -> S -> S
I: S
O: S
Opp: S -> S
v: S -> nat

Goal:
is_ring -> forall d : S, is_gcd O O d -> d = O

Premises:
is_ring = commutativity S Add /\ is_group S A Add O Opp /\ intern S A Mult /\ associativity S Mult /\ distributivity S Add Mult : Prop
is_gcd = fun a b d : S => divide d a /\ divide d b /\ (forall q : S, divide q a -> divide q b -> divide q d) : S -> S -> S -> Prop
opp_unicity : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x
opp_neutral : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> Opp O = O
VectorDef.nth_order : VectorDef.t ?A ?n -> forall p : nat, p < ?n -> ?A where ?A : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- Type] ?n : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- nat]
Fin.FS_inj : forall x y : Fin.t ?n, Fin.FS x = Fin.FS y -> x = y where ?n : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- nat]
opp_opp : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall x : S, G x -> x = Opp (Opp x)
VectorDef.const : ?A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n where ?A : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- Type]
Fin.eq_dec : forall x y : Fin.t ?n, {x = y} + {x <> y} where ?n : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- nat]
Fin.L_R : forall n : nat, Fin.t ?m -> Fin.t (n + ?m) where ?m : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- nat]
regular_l : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall y z : S, G y -> G z -> forall x : S, G x -> Add x y = Add x z -> y = z
VectorDef.caseS : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S n) -> Type, (forall (h : ?A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t ?A n), P n (VectorDef.cons ?A h n t)) -> forall (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S n)), P n v where ?A : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- Type]
is_opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
div_add : is_ring -> forall a b d : S, divide d a -> divide d b -> divide d (Add a b)
div_opp : is_ring -> forall a d : S, divide d a -> divide d (Opp a)
divide = fun a b : S => A a /\ A b /\ (b = O \/ a <> O /\ (exists q : S, A q /\ b = Mult a q)) : S -> S -> Prop
VectorDef.rectS : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S n) -> Type, (forall a : ?A, P 0 (VectorDef.cons ?A a 0 (VectorDef.nil ?A))) -> (forall (a : ?A) (n : nat) (v0 : VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S n)), P n v0 -> P (Datatypes.S n) (VectorDef.cons ?A a (Datatypes.S n) v0)) -> forall (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S n)), P n v where ?A : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- Type]
div_mult : is_ring -> forall a b d : S, divide d a -> A b -> divide d (Mult a b)
div_O_O = fun H : is_ring => and_ind (fun (_ : commutativity S Add) (H1 : is_group S A Add O Opp /\ intern S A Mult /\ associativity S Mult /\ distributivity S Add Mult) => and_ind (fun (H2 : is_group S A Add O Opp) (_ : intern S A Mult /\ associativity S Mult /\ distributivity S Add Mult) => and_ind (fun (_ : intern S A Add) (H5 : associativity S Add /\ neutral S A Add O /\ opposite S A Add O Opp) => and_ind (fun (_ : associativity S Add) (H7 : neutral S A Add O /\ opposite S A Add O Opp) => and_ind (fun (H8 : neutral S A Add O) (_ : opposite S A Add O Opp) => and_ind (fun (H10 : A O) (_ : forall x : S, A x -> Add x O = x /\ Add O x = x) => conj H10 (conj H10 (or_introl eq_refl))) H8) H7) H5) H2) H1) H : is_ring ->...
distributivity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
neutral : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> Prop
opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
is_group : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
commutativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
associativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
intern : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments Datatypes.S _%nat_scope
mult_O : is_ring -> forall x : S, A x -> Mult x O = O /\ Mult O x = O
gcd_null : forall a b : S, is_gcd a b O -> a = O /\ b = O
is_unitary_commutative_ring = is_ring /\ commutativity S Mult /\ neutral S A Mult I : Prop
mult_opp_opp : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult (Opp x) (Opp y) = Mult x y
mult_opp_l : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult (Opp x) y = Opp (Mult x y)
mult_opp_r : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult x (Opp y) = Opp (Mult x y)
List.nth_split : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (l : list A) (d : A), n < length l -> exists l1 l2 : list A, l = (l1 ++ List.nth n l d :: l2)%list /\ length l1 = n
PeanoNat.Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.divide_antisym_nonneg : forall n m : nat, 0 <= n -> 0 <= m -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide n m -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide m n -> n = m
PeanoNat.Nat.gcd_unique : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide p n -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide p m -> (forall q : nat, PeanoNat.Nat.divide q n -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide q m -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide q p) -> PeanoNat.Nat.gcd n m = p
PeanoNat.Nat.lcm_unique : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide n p -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide m p -> (forall q : nat, PeanoNat.Nat.divide n q -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide m q -> PeanoNat.Nat.divide p q) -> PeanoNat.Nat.lcm n m = p
Pnat.Nat2Pos.inj : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m <> 0 -> BinPos.Pos.of_nat n = BinPos.Pos.of_nat m -> n = m
PeanoNat.Nat.pred_inj : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m <> 0 -> PeanoNat.Nat.pred n = PeanoNat.Nat.pred m -> n = m
PeanoNat.Nat.testbit_bitwise_2 : forall op : bool -> bool -> bool, op false false = false -> forall n m a b : nat, a <= n -> b <= n -> PeanoNat.Nat.testbit (PeanoNat.Nat.bitwise op n a b) m = op (PeanoNat.Nat.testbit a m) (PeanoNat.Nat.testbit b m)
List.nth : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> A -> A

```coq
intros H d Hgcd.
destruct Hgcd as [HdO [HdO' Hgcd']].
apply gcd_null in HdO as HdOeq. apply HdOeq.
Qed.```

original: intros H d Hgcd. destruct Hgcd as [HdO [HdO' Hgcd']]. apply gcd_null in HdO as HdOeq. apply HdOeq.
